title: Highest Physician Density
description: In 2021, Cuba had 9.429 physicians per 1,000 people, one of the highest densities globally, showcasing its strong healthcare system.

title: Complete Rural Birth Registration
description: As of 2019, Cuba achieved 100% completeness in rural birth registration, ensuring every child's birth is officially recorded.

title: High Transaction Costs for Remittances
description: In 2023, the average cost of sending remittances to Cuba was 19.63%, one of the highest globally, indicating a significant barrier for financial inflows.

title: Low Merchandise Trade as a Percentage of GDP
description: In 2020, merchandise trade accounted for only 8.32% of Cuba's GDP, reflecting limited trade engagement compared to other nations.

title: Minimal Net Official Flows from UN Agencies (UNAIDS)
description: In 2017, Cuba received $500 from UNAIDS, one of the lowest net official flows, indicating limited financial support from this agency.

title: Negative Net Official Flows from UN Agencies (WTO-ITC)
description: In 2020, Cuba experienced a negative net flow of -$3 from WTO-ITC, highlighting a financial outflow rather than support.

title: High Proportion of Time Spent on Unpaid Domestic Work by Males
description: In 2016, Cuban males spent 12.47% of their day on unpaid domestic and care work, a significant portion compared to global averages.

title: High Residual Merchandise Exports
description: In 2023, residual merchandise exports accounted for 4.05% of Cuba's total merchandise exports, indicating a notable portion of trade activity.
